[{'comment_id': 838210686, 'comment_body': "Hey @anujaraj have you tested this locally? I'm pretty sure the text needs to be in quotation marks - see the docs for reference. Intentionally using old docs as we are still supporting old Django. https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.0/topics/i18n/translation/#trans-template-tag", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 30, 7, 34, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'lb-', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 838211183, 'comment_body': 'Also. This new line will add unwanted whitespace to the translation text. Either use blocktrans or bring it back to one line. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 30, 7, 35, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'lb-', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 838216749, 'comment_body': 'Yes i will be using blocktrans. I have written the corrected synatx in the comment above before i could push the code. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 30, 7, 41, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'anujaraj', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 838330857, 'comment_body': 'Please can you add `trimmed` to the blocktrans `{% blocktrans trimmed %}` Also please remove the added whitespace before ` This` and after `workflow? `', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 30, 9, 32, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'lb-', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 838331768, 'comment_body': "Also .I don't think you need the single quotes around the variable usage. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 30, 9, 33, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'lb-', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 838341659, 'comment_body': 'yes trimmed shall remove all extra spaces. I did it. I will commit now. Thank you for pointing the trimmed tag out', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 30, 9, 42, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'anujaraj', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 841118134, 'comment_body': '```suggestion Are you sure you want to delete this workflow?{% endblocktrans %}

``` One small space still ended up in this - suggested fix above. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 4, 2, 20, 50, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'lb-', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 841118474, 'comment_body': 'I think we probably also want a [`{% plural %}` tag](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/4.0/topics/i18n/translation/#blocktranslate-template-tag) here, to account for the text reading "1 page" vs "2 pages".', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 4, 2, 20, 54, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'gasman', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 841122295, 'comment_body': 'Here we need to use plural when the {{ workflow_states_in_progress }} >1 how do i access the number of pages in the example its - {% blocktrans count counter=list|length %} can i use workflow_states_in_progress instead of list. I did search to see if i could find workflow_states_in_progress somewhere else in the code to understand its attributes better, can you help me understand this part. Thank you', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 4, 2, 21, 39, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'anujaraj', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Added a forced-color media query to disabled buttons in high contrast
pr_body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing to Wagtail! ðŸŽ‰

Before submitting, please review the [contributor guidelines](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/index.html).
-->

_Please check the following:_

-   [ ] Do the tests still pass?[^1]
-   [ ] Does the code comply with the style guide?
    -   [ ] Run `make lint` from the Wagtail root.
-   [ ] For front-end changes: Did you test on all of Wagtailâ€™s supported environments?[^2]
    -   [x] **Please list the exact browser and operating system versions you tested**: Operating System : Windows 11, Browser: Chrome
    -   [x] **Please list which assistive technologies [^3] you tested**: Windows High Contrast Themes : Aquatic,Desert,Dusk,Night Sky

**Please describe additional details for testing this change**.
This PR fixes #7449 
Following changes were intended in this PR:
1. Added a @media query in forced-colors for the disabled buttons inside file path - `client\scss\components\_button.scss`
2. Added dashed border style in the query to make it more distinct in comparision to normal buttons
3. Added GrayText  and border-color: currentColor

Screenshots intending the above changes are below:
Dark Mode

![Screenshot (171)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52713215/181085063-c21f04d0-82bb-4b1b-b2e2-f4c93365d6ad.png)

Light Mode

![Screenshot (170)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52713215/181085148-7f1efd11-faef-4b18-bcfb-8182f83940c4.png)


[^1]: [Development Testing](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#testing)
[^2]: [Browser and device support](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#browser-and-device-support)
[^3]: [Accessibility Target](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#accessibility-targets)

pr_title: Progressbar made visible in high contrast
pr_body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing to Wagtail! ðŸŽ‰

Before submitting, please review the [contributor guidelines](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/index.html).
-->

_Please check the following:_

-   [ ] Do the tests still pass?[^1]
-   [ ] Does the code comply with the style guide?
    -   [ ] Run `make lint` from the Wagtail root.
-   [ ] For front-end changes: Did you test on all of Wagtailâ€™s supported environments?[^2]
    -   [x] **Please list the exact browser and operating system versions you tested**: Operating System- Windows 11 , Browser : Chrome
    -   [x] **Please list which assistive technologies [^3] you tested**: Contrast themes in Windows 11 - Aquatic, Dusk,Desert,Night Sky

**Please describe additional details for testing this change**.

Step 1: Turn On Any mode in contrast themes in Windows 
Step 2: Go to documents in the Menu of the wagtail Admin 
Step 3: Click on Upload and select a document
Step4: You should be able to see the progress bar visible even in contrast modes

[^1]: [Development Testing](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#testing)
[^2]: [Browser and device support](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#browser-and-device-support)
[^3]: [Accessibility Target](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#accessibility-targets)

pr_title: Removed the forced-colors media query over icons to avoid override
pr_body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing to Wagtail! ðŸŽ‰

Before submitting, please review the [contributor guidelines](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/index.html).
-->

_Please check the following:_

-   [ ] Do the tests still pass?[^1]
-   [ ] Does the code comply with the style guide?
    -   [ ] Run `make lint` from the Wagtail root.
-   [ ] For front-end changes: Did you test on all of Wagtailâ€™s supported environments?[^2]
    -   [x] **Please list the exact browser and operating system versions you tested**: Tested in Chrome
    -   [x] **Please list which assistive technologies [^3] you tested**:Windows 11 high contrast modes - Dessert,Night sky,Dusk,Aquatic
-   [ ] For new features: Has the documentation been updated accordingly?

**Please describe additional details for testing this change**.
The PR is a fix to issue #8816 
To achieve the disired result I commented the media query for forced-colors over the icons. The query was added when chrome was having a bug due to which a override on icons using fill (a css property) was required. Since the bug is remved we would want to remove the override too. 
The change is made in `client/scss/components/_icons.scss`
The screenshots are attached below showing the override being removed in both modes (dark and light) of WHCM

![Screenshot (110)icons](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52713215/179046007-80a1eb9a-6b45-42f2-9c4e-feab91eb0f4a.png)


[^1]: [Development Testing](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#testing)
[^2]: [Browser and device support](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#browser-and-device-support)
[^3]: [Accessibility Target](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#accessibility-targets)
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 921215156, 'comment_body': "Go ahead and delete this whole block. We only want to leave commented code in the codebase if we intend to reuse it at some point, which I don't think is true in this case.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 14, 14, 22, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Scotchester', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Contrast themes: help block border styles
pr_body:
#8816. Added new border styles to help boxes and made the text inside the help box visible in forced-color mode.

<!--
Thanks for contributing to Wagtail! ðŸŽ‰

Before submitting, please review the [contributor guidelines](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/index.html).
-->

_Please check the following:_

-   [ ] Do the tests still pass?[^1]
-   [ ] Does the code comply with the style guide?
    -   [ ] Run `make lint` from the Wagtail root.
-   [ ] For Python changes: Have you added tests to cover the new/fixed behaviour?
-   [ ] For front-end changes: Did you test on all of Wagtailâ€™s supported environments?[^2]
    -   [x] **Please list the exact browser and operating system versions you tested**: Tested in Chrome, Operating System -Windows 11
    -   [x] **Please list which assistive technologies [^3] you tested**: Windows 11 high contrast modes : Night sky,Dusk,Desert,Aquatic
-   [ ] For new features: Has the documentation been updated accordingly?

**Please describe additional details for testing this change**.
This fixes issue- #8817 
The boxes(help,critical message and warning boxes) were styled oddly giving a visual traffic to eyes in WHMC.  The PR added three types of borders to the three kinds of boxes and removed any color from texts or borders. This provides a distinct look as well as more visual clarity to the viewer in WHMC.
Along with border styling the issue pertaining to text inside the first box (help box) in lighter modes of high contrast earlier was not visible as in the below screenshot

![Screenshot (101)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52713215/178974680-9ac8aa52-9c1b-405e-b05b-4d8fdbb199da.png)

Its is visible now after the changes made in this PR.
The changes are made in `client\scss\components\_help-block.scss`

Screenshots of the changes are added below

Dark mode

![Screenshot (111)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52713215/178974189-2c899c18-32b8-48a9-9c06-efb1bafda562.png)

Light mode

![Screenshot (110)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52713215/178974221-b11305df-0e98-4f6c-91c6-cb2ba51ff7a0.png)

[^1]: [Development Testing](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#testing)
[^2]: [Browser and device support](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#browser-and-device-support)
[^3]: [Accessibility Target](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#accessibility-targets)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 922548268, 'comment_body': 'I donâ€™t think we want the help blocks to appear as links so to me it seems most appropriate to give them the same color as the text (so CanvasText) by default.

```suggestion
    border: 3px solid currentColor;
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 15, 22, 12, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'thibaudcolas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 922548557, 'comment_body': '`$color-text-warning-forced-color` isnâ€™t doing anything without `forced-color-adjust: none`, so this could be replaced by:

```suggestion
    border-style: dotted;
```

All other border styles will inherit from `help-block` above.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 15, 22, 13, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'thibaudcolas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 922548630, 'comment_body': 'Same as above, `border-style: dashed;`.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 15, 22, 13, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'thibaudcolas', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Added border to tooltip dropdown for high contrast
pr_body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing to Wagtail! ðŸŽ‰

Before submitting, please review the [contributor guidelines](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/index.html).
-->

_Please check the following:_

-   [ ] Do the tests still pass?[^1]
-   [ ] Does the code comply with the style guide?
    -   [ ] Run `make lint` from the Wagtail root.
-   [x] For front-end changes: Did you test on all of Wagtailâ€™s supported environments?[^2]
    -   [x] **Please list the exact browser and operating system versions you tested**: Operating System- Windows 11, Browser- Chrome
    -   [x] **Please list which assistive technologies [^3] you tested**: Windows 11 contrast themes- Aquatic, Desert,Dusk,Night Sky

**Please describe additional details for testing this change**.
This PR fixes #8830 
This PR adds a border to the tooltip dropdown to allow it to be visible distinctly from the background in windows high contrast modes. The file changed : `\client\scss\components\_dropdown.scss`
Below are screenshots relating to the changes in reference to this PR

![Screenshot (147)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52713215/180615646-9c431098-570f-47f5-8b85-38bd65fa9a44.png)

![Screenshot (148)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52713215/180615657-bfffe95e-4956-4f6d-93b7-ac33a2c9826b.png)


[^1]: [Development Testing](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#testing)
[^2]: [Browser and device support](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#browser-and-device-support)

pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 936713567, 'comment_body': 'This also has an undesirable effect for regular users; please move this into a forced-colors media query.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 3, 14, 9, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Scotchester', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Fix for npm lint format issue in windows
pr_body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing to Wagtail! ðŸŽ‰

Before submitting, please review the [contributor guidelines](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/index.html).
-->

_Please check the following:_

-   [ ] Do the tests still pass?[^1]
-   [x] Does the code comply with the style guide?
    -   [x] Run `make lint` from the Wagtail root.
-   [x] For front-end changes: Did you test on all of Wagtailâ€™s supported environments?[^2]
    -   [x] **Please list the exact browser and operating system versions you tested**:Operating System: Windows

**Please describe additional details for testing this change**.
Steps to recreate the issue:
Step1 : While running npm run lint:format in windows, an error like this -[error] No matching files. Patterns tried: './{src,bin,test}/**/*.{js,json,md}' !**/node_modules/** !./node_modules/** pops up


[^1]: [Development Testing](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#testing)
[^2]: [Browser and device support](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#browser-and-device-support)
[^3]: [Accessibility Target](https://docs.wagtail.org/en/latest/contributing/developing.html#accessibility-targets)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 904027310, 'comment_body': 'Looks like we'll need to use escaped double quotes, like this:

```suggestion
    "lint:format": "prettier --check \"**/?(.)*.{css,scss,js,ts,tsx,json,yaml,yml}\"",
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 22, 16, 57, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Scotchester', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 904028281, 'comment_body': 'I realized that we have the same problem with the `format` command and we'll need to apply the same changes here:

```suggestion
    "format": "prettier --write \"**/?(.)*.{css,scss,js,ts,tsx,json,yaml,yml}\"",
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 22, 16, 58, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Scotchester', 'type': 'User'}]
